result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard S. Steinhofer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard S. Steinhofer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard S. Steinhofer was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard S. Steinhofer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $805.00 due in 30 days or 10 days KCJ.
Amended Info
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears with Atty Jerold Breitenbach.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  912 - Case has resolved. Amended information filed. DE enters plea of guilty to amended Ct1 - found guilty by the court. Ct2 of amended information dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations made.  Court orders a $200 fine plus costs, due in 30 days or 10 days in KCJ. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Appeal rights given.

ST appears by ADA Tom Binger. DE appears in person with Atty Jerold Breitenbach.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  936 - ST requests adjournment due to ADA Zapf's illness. No objection to adjournment - possible resolution discussion.  Jury selection scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Jerold Breitenbach.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  934 - JT rescheduled.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears with Atty Jerold Breitenbach.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 201 -   State is compliant with victim rights notification.  DE reports that he is no longer available on 1/4 for JT - as he has been given a 2nd case for the same date in another branch which can not be scheduled for a different date.  Court approves new date. Jury trial rescheduled to Februrary 1, 2016 @ 9am.
And demand for discovery - filed by - ADA T Braun
State's lis of Exhibits - filed by ADA T Braun.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jerrold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:40am-  Matter is not resolved.  DE requests matter be set for trial.  Court sets matter for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 11/13/2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
Per Atty Breitenbach, motion was resolved, so he did not appear for the motion hearing today at 9:00.  FPT set for 10/2/15 at 10:30.  Def. was in court and given the new hearing date.
& Motion - filed by Attorney Jerold Breitenbach

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:38am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Breitenbach still has not received photos of the DE.  State sent a request for the photos to Joint Services but does not have a response since that request was made.  If photos cannot be produced, Attorney Breitenbach intends on filing a motion to dismiss.  Discussion held.  Court sets tenative motion hearing for September 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Motion to be filed by 8/14/2015.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:30pm-  Attorney Breitenbach received a disk from joint services but none of the photos are of the DE.  State did not receive copies of the photos taken of the DE either and will look into the issue.  Court adjourns matter to August 5, 2015 at 09:30 am to allow parties time to sort out discovery issues.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:33am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Breitenbach had requested photographs from Joint Services & has yet to receive them.  State received the photographs & can provide Attorney Breitenbach with a copy of the disc.  Court adjourns matter to June 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Bond continued.
$500 posted on 4-15-15

**MODIFIED**     *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Bridget S or her residence
940.235(1) - Strangulation and suffocation DV  /  947.01(1) - DC DV

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Jerold Breitenbach. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Breitenbach. Tab pulled for Judge S. Michael Wilk. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-11-15 @ 8:30am. Atty. Breitenbach has filed bond motion and argues for bond modification. State opposes bond modification. Bond modified to $500 cash with the same conditions.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Breitenbach. Tab pulled for Judge S. Michael Wilk.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Bridget S or her residence.
